visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: 'Monthly Average Temperature', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The data series should include the name 'Temperature' and the data provided in the JavaScript code. Custom colors: Use a gradient from blue to red for the line. Additional configurations: Set the chart margins to 50px on all sides, add a light gray background (#f0f0f0) to the chart, and include a legend at the bottom of the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart with a title 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart type is set to 'line', and it includes a zooming feature for both x and y axes. The axes labels and titles are styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The data series includes the name 'Temperature' and the given data points. The line color is a gradient from blue to red, which visually represents the temperature changes. The chart has a light gray background and margins of 50px on all sides. Additionally, a legend is included at the bottom of the chart, providing a clear reference to the data series.
